document_title: Eclampsia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Below are questions that many pregnant women are interested in, sent to Tam Anh General Hospital:
1. If you have had pre-eclampsia or eclampsia, is there a risk of getting it again? How to avoid?
Preeclampsia can occur in pregnant women with a history of diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), kidney disease, obesity, diabetes, older women, etc. during the 20th week of pregnancy. In case the pregnant woman has a history of previous illness, the risk of recurrence is also quite high. However, pregnant women can recognize signs of blood pressure or high protein levels in urine at an early stage if they have regular check-ups. In addition, "biomarkers" can predict the risk of disease for pregnant women.
See more specific answers from Associate Professor, Dr. Luu Thi Hong - Head of Obstetrics and Gynecology Department of Tam Anh General Hospital on this issue
With the desire to provide safe, 5-star prenatal examination and birth services, preventing dangerous obstetric complications such as eclampsia, twin blood transfusions, amniotic embolism, etc. Tam Anh General Hospital deploys pregnancy services package product. With this service, pregnant women can feel completely secure when receiving special care from leading Obstetrics and Pediatrics experts, as well as being supported by the most modern equipment system right from pregnancy to pregnancy. when the baby is born.
For maternity advice and to schedule a health care examination for mother and fetus at Tam Anh General Hospital, please contact:
108 Hoang Nhu Tiep, Bo De Ward, Long Bien District, Hanoi City
Hotline: 024 3872 3872 – 024 7106 6858
2B Pho Quang, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City
Hotline: 0287 102 6789 – 093 180 6858
Fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/benhvientamanh
Preeclampsia and eclampsia are always a concern for any woman during pregnancy. However, a reasonable diet, lifestyle and regular prenatal check-ups will help pregnant mothers control and avoid the risk of disease.
